actor_awards.notes: Laurel received an Honorary Academy Award in 1961 for his 'creative pioneering in the field of cinema comedy.' He also received a competitive Oscar as the producer of 'The Music Box' (Best Live Action Short) in 1932.

filmography.title: Sons of the Desert
filmography.role_description: A henpecked husband who, along with his partner Ollie, concocts a fake medical trip to Honolulu to attend a fraternal lodge convention in Chicago.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie deceive their wives to attend a convention of the 'Sons of the Desert' lodge, but their scheme unravels when the ship they were supposedly on sinks.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (2012); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Laughs (#96)

filmography.title: The Music Box
filmography.role_description: A bumbling delivery man tasked with moving a player piano up a massive flight of stairs in this definitive comedy short.
filmography.plot: Delivery men Stan and Ollie struggle to push a heavy piano up a dauntingly long flight of stairs to a house at the top.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Short Subject, Comedy; National Film Registry: Inducted (1997)

filmography.title: Way Out West
filmography.role_description: A prospector who travels to the town of Brushwood Gulch to deliver a deed to a gold mine, featuring the famous 'At the Ball, That's All' dance routine.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie travel to the Wild West to deliver the deed to a gold mine to the daughter of a dead prospector, but get swindled by a saloon owner.

filmography.title: Babes in Toyland
filmography.role_description: An apprentice toymaker who lives in a shoe and accidentally makes 100 six-foot soldiers instead of 600 one-foot soldiers.
filmography.plot: Stannie Dum and Ollie Dee try to borrow money from their employer to pay off the mortgage on Mother Peep's shoe and stop the villainous Barnaby.

filmography.title: Block-Heads
filmography.role_description: A WWI soldier who unknowingly guards a trench for twenty years after the war ends, finally reuniting with Ollie in 1938.
filmography.plot: Stan stays in the trenches for 20 years after WWI ends; Ollie brings him home to meet the wife and chaos ensues.

filmography.title: Big Business
filmography.role_description: A Christmas tree salesman who gets into an escalating tit-for-tat battle of destruction with a grumpy homeowner.
filmography.plot: Christmas tree salesmen Stan and Ollie get into a destructive feud with a homeowner who refuses to buy a tree.

filmography.title: A Chump at Oxford
filmography.role_description: Stan plays a dual role: his usual dim-witted self and, after a blow to the head, a brilliant and snooty British aristocrat scholar.
filmography.plot: Two street sweepers accidentally capture a bank robber and are rewarded with a scholarship to Oxford University.

filmography.title: The Devil's Brother (Fra Diavolo)
filmography.role_description: A bumbling would-be bandit who, along with Ollio, is forced to become the servant of the notorious outlaw Fra Diavolo.
filmography.plot: Stanlio and Ollio try to become bandits but end up working as servants for the legendary bandit Fra Diavolo.

filmography.title: The Flying Deuces
filmography.role_description: A fish market worker who joins the French Foreign Legion with Ollie so Ollie can forget a lost love.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie join the Foreign Legion to help Ollie forget a broken heart, but they soon realize army life isn't for them.

filmography.title: Hog Wild
filmography.role_description: A well-meaning friend who helps Ollie install a radio antenna on his roof, leading to a series of catastrophic falls.
filmography.plot: Ollie attempts to install a radio antenna on his roof with Stan's help, resulting in destruction and a wild car ride.

filmography.title: County Hospital
filmography.role_description: A visitor to the hospital who brings his friend Ollie hard-boiled eggs and nuts, causing chaos for the staff and patient.
filmography.plot: Stan visits Ollie in the hospital and manages to get him kicked out after accidentally hanging the doctor out of a window.

filmography.title: One Good Turn
filmography.role_description: A victim of the Depression who tries to help a widow, only to be falsely accused of theft by Ollie.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie auction off their car to help a widow they believe is being evicted, but a wallet mix-up causes trouble.

filmography.title: Come Clean
filmography.role_description: A friend who wants to go out for ice cream but ends up helping Ollie hide a woman they saved from suicide.
filmography.plot: The boys save a woman from suicide, but she threatens to blackmail them if they don't take care of her, hiding her from their wives.

filmography.title: Two Tars
filmography.role_description: A sailor on shore leave who gets into a massive traffic jam and subsequent battle with other motorists.
filmography.plot: Two sailors on shore leave rent a car and get into a huge traffic jam that escalates into a free-for-all of vandalism.

filmography.title: The Midnight Patrol
filmography.role_description: An incompetent police officer who mistakes a safe cracker for the owner of the safe and arrests the actual Chief of Police.
filmography.plot: Rookie cops Stan and Ollie investigate a burglary but end up arresting the wrong man—their own Police Chief.

filmography.title: Brats
filmography.role_description: Laurel plays a dual role as both the father and his own mischievous young son in this comedy featuring oversized sets.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie babysit their own sons (played by themselves in smaller versions) while their wives are out.

filmography.title: The Chimp
filmography.role_description: A circus worker who receives a flea circus as a severance package but ends up with a gorilla named Ethel.
filmography.plot: When the circus goes bust, Stan and Ollie are paid off with a flea circus and a gorilla, which they try to sneak into a hotel.

filmography.title: Me and My Pal
filmography.role_description: A friend who brings a jigsaw puzzle to Ollie on his wedding day, distracting everyone until the wedding is ruined.
filmography.plot: Ollie is about to get married, but Stan arrives with a jigsaw puzzle that consumes the attention of the groom and all the guests.

filmography.title: Helpmates
filmography.role_description: A well-intentioned friend who agrees to help Ollie clean his house after a wild party, but ends up destroying it.
filmography.plot: Ollie asks Stan to help him clean up his house before his wife returns, but Stan's help leads to the house's destruction.

filmography.title: Towed in a Hole
filmography.role_description: A fish monger who convinces Ollie to catch their own fish, leading to a disastrous attempt to fix up a boat.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie decide to cut out the middleman and catch their own fish, but their attempt to repair a boat goes horribly wrong.

filmography.title: Tit for Tat
filmography.role_description: An electrical store owner who engages in a destructive reciprocal feud with the grocer next door.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie open an electrical store and get into a tit-for-tat battle of destruction with their neighbor, a grocer.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Short Subject, Comedy

filmography.title: Busy Bodies
filmography.role_description: A carpenter at a sawmill who inadvertently causes a series of painful accidents for his partner Ollie.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie work at a sawmill where their incompetence leads to a series of disasters involving saws, glue, and windows.

filmography.title: Their First Mistake
filmography.role_description: A friend who advises Ollie to adopt a baby to save his marriage, only to end up helping raise the child when Ollie's wife leaves.
filmography.plot: Stan convinces Ollie to adopt a baby to keep his wife occupied, but she leaves, forcing the two men to care for the infant.

filmography.title: Berth Marks
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville musician traveling by train to a gig who struggles with the cramped quarters of a sleeping car.
filmography.plot: Stan and Ollie are musicians travelling by train who cause a disturbance while trying to get undressed in a sleeping berth.

filmography.title: Liberty
filmography.role_description: An escaped convict who ends up atop the skeleton of a skyscraper under construction while trying to change trousers.
filmography.plot: Escaped convicts Stan and Ollie try to exchange trousers in an alley but wind up on the girders of an unfinished skyscraper.
